title: [Large-scale] Constructivist-Based Embedded Systems Practical Education: Language-Integrated Control Programming

context.prior_knowledge: Basic C programming, digital logic circuit understanding, introductory experience with embedded platforms (e.g., Arduino), and ability to interpret technical documents and grasp fundamental programming language structures
context.additional_context: Emphasizes a constructivist approach where learners define problems and implement solutions in a practice-oriented environment. Accumulates real-world system development experience through project-based assessments. Focuses on designing command systems for embedded system control and cultivating technical communication skills.

learning_goals: Learners design algorithmic representations and command structures for peripheral device control programs using embedded system development toolchains.
Learners implement IoT prototypes solving real-world problems via constructivist approaches and develop protocol languages (communication conventions) for system interoperability.
Learners debug and optimize system integration issues in collaborative environments, enhancing technical language proficiency for documentation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
